input.name: __VIEWSTATEGENERATOR

div.div:
CORONAVIRUS (COVID-19)
The health and safety of our students, staff and community is our highest priority and Jim Ned CISD is closely monitoring the spread of COVID-19. We are following the guidance from the Texas Department of State and Health Services (DSHS), the Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the Taylor County Health Department to ensure our students and staff remain as healthy as possible.
With information changing daily, please be assured that Jim Ned CISD will continue to be in communication with our local partners and stand ready to take all appropriate measures. As of March 18, 2020, JNCISD is closed to students and parents on an indefinite basis. Based on the recommendations of those in the medical community and out of an abundance of caution, it was necessary to close to reduce the spread of this new communicable disease that could potentially affect the health of of our students, staff, and families.
We want our parents and staff to know that JNCISD plans to re-open our schools as soon as possible should the threat of the virus subside. But we all need to prepare for a long-term closure which may include a possible end to our 2019-20 school year. The mere thought of that causes our hearts to go out to all of our students, parents, and staff, but particularly to our seniors.
Let's all pray that the spread of the virus ends quickly! In the meantime, let's all work together for the best of our students, staff, families, and our Jim Ned community. Roll Tribe!

p.strong: JNCISD began providing meals to our students beginning March 19, 2020. Meals will continue to be provided for the duration of the school closure for our students.

div.p: 1) Meal Pickup: As of Monday, April 6, 2020, breakfast and lunch will be provided from 10:00am-1:00pm on Monday & Thursday. On Monday, we will handout/deliver breakfast & lunch for 3 days, including Monday, Tuesday, & Wednesday meals. Then, on Thursday, we will handout/deliver meals to cover Thursday & Friday. A light breakfast (cereal, yogurt, fruit, milk) & sack lunches (sandwich, chips, etc.) will be served. Any of our students who need breakfast or lunch will be provided meals on Mondays & Thursdays.

2) Locations: Meals can be picked up at either Lawn Elementary or Buffalo Gap Elementary. No pickups at the Middle School or High School. Pickups will be available at either elementary, no matter your attendance zone.

p.strong: 3) Parents no longer have to have their kids with them when they pick up the meals. The federal and state government has removed this requirement to allow parents to help with good social distancing practices.

div.p: 4) Curbside: All meal pickups will be delivered curbside. We will have staff bring the meal to each vehicle to ensure social distancing & reduce the spread of the virus.

5) Meal Delivery: We will deliver meals to those who have no means to get to a campus for meal pickup. For those in need of delivery, call a campus office any time and share your name, address, # of meals needed, & also share a call back number or leave a voice message with the office staff.
6) Volunteers: The district will have paid staff serving at each cafeteria location, but many of our other staff members have volunteered to assist as well with meal service.

p.strong: If you have any questions, please call one of the campuses. Stay safe & please be careful of where you go & what you do so we limit the spread of the coronavirus. Wash your hands & stay put as much as possible.
Pray the virus ends soon & that our JN community remains virus-free!

div.p: JNCISD has built a framework for our PK-12 instructional delivery system that will help us educate our students in this season of "School @ Home." Our goal is to continue to provide quality educational opportunities for our students while our school is closed to students. We have built a system that is user-friendly for our students, parents, and others who may be partnering with our parents.

For those with a device & internet access, our teachers are providing learning opportunities for their students. Our students and parents should plan on about 2-hours of work per day per student. Our teachers will continue to provide both online learning opportunities and also packets (for any family that needs it). Students will not be required to complete both online learning and packets; they will just complete which works best for them. Our teachers will remain in touch with each of their students to ensure they have what they need to be successful!

We received great feedback from our Technology Survey regarding Online Access at Home. Most of our families have some sort of access to a computer, laptop, or tablet and most also have internet access. Therefore, most of our families are equipped for an online learning environment.

While our schools are closed, the district plans to provide support for our families in need of technology access, beginning Monday, April 6th. The district's goal is to loan families in need 1 Chromebook (laptop) and also provide access to basic internet service for that device. Chromebook check-outs begin Thursday, April 2nd. We are still developing our plan for internet access, so please be patient as we continue to get it fully developed. There is an incredible demand for internet-access throughout our state/nation as you can imagine & that has slowed our plans to assist our families. We are working as quickly as we can!

p.style: color: #333333; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; font-size: 16px; background-color: #ffffff;
p.span: The coronavirus may have caused some concerns or anxieties among students, staff, and parents. Knowing this, our district is hear to listen and help in any way we can. We want our students and families to know that each of you is loved and cared for. Please let us know your concerns or if you just need someone to talk to in the coming days during our school closure. Simply complete the form below and one of our awesome school counselors will be in touch with you as soon as possible. In the meantime, know that we will get through this together and there is hope for great days ahead! Talk with you soon!

a.title: ezTask: Exceptional websites that are affordable and easy to update!
